Body:
In Thai สบายดี is sà-bāɪ-dīː(sà with a low tone, bāɪ and dī with mid tones).

In Lao ສະບາຍດີ is sá-bàɪ-dìː (sá with a high tone, bàɪ and dìː with low tones).

Okay, I need confirmation on the tones in Lao. The Thai "sabaidi" is confirmed and good. I keep getting difference of opinion on the Lao "sabaidi". I am looking for the tones as spoken in the Vientiane dialect of Lao.

For Thai tones, I am using 1) Mid 2) Low 3) Falling 4) High 5) Rising

For Lao tones, I am using 1) Mid 2) Low 3) High Falling 4) Low Falling 5) High 6) Rising
Title: Can someone confirm the Lao language tones in the greeting "sabaidi"
